abstract: The dispute began two months ago when the federal agency sought Apple’s help to gain access to a phone used by an attacker in a mass shooting.
snippet: The dispute began two months ago when the federal agency sought Apple’s help to gain access to a phone used by an attacker in a mass shooting.
lead_paragraph: Apple told a federal court on Friday that it should not have to help the F.B.I. unlock an iPhone used by a Brooklyn drug dealer and that the case would lead to “an avalanche” of similar demands if prosecutors prevailed.

headline.main: In New Filing, Apple Resists F.B.I.’s Call to Open iPhone in Drug Case
headline.print_headline: Apple Again Resists Call  to Help in New York Case
